column4: I have a server with two nics, one for external, one for internal, external interface is configured to obtain its address with dhcp.
The dhcp server provides a domain-name-server ip for use in /etc/resolv.conf
my question is how do I tell ubuntu to use a different ip than the one provided for the /etc/resolv.conf file

my problem is that when my external interface gets its IP from the dhcp server it gets a domain-name-server in the dhcp packet, and it rewrites /etc/resolv.conf in response, I want to intercept that /etc/resolv.conf rewrite and fix the ip address
you can usually adjust whether the nameserver is changed from the program you connect with
like for dial-up there is something you can change in the ppp config
what kind of connection do you have? adsl, cable?
why don't you like the nameserver your ISP is giving you?
i hope you aren't downloading some kind of wierd porn
no, im setting up a home router with its own dns server in case there ever would be an internet outage my internal stuff would still work
like i say, it's a setting somewhere whether to accept the ISPs nameserver ... i'm not on ubuntu atm so i can't tell you
the setting will be in the program that makes the connection to your isp
